lessons.title: What is Media Literacy?
lessons.content: Media literacy is the ability to access, analyze, evaluate, and create media in a variety of forms. It helps individuals understand the complex messages we receive from television, radio, internet, newspapers, and other forms of media.

lessons.title: The Importance of Media Literacy
lessons.content: In today's digital age, media literacy is crucial for navigating the vast amount of information available. It empowers individuals to critically evaluate media messages and make informed decisions.

lessons.title: Analyzing Media Messages
lessons.content: This lesson focuses on techniques for analyzing media messages, including identifying the purpose, target audience, and underlying values or biases present in the content.

lessons.title: Evaluating Sources
lessons.content: Learn how to evaluate the credibility of different media sources by examining their authorship, publication date, and potential biases.
